title: Jesse Ventura - Wikipedia
snippet: Jesse Ventura (born James George Janos; July 15, 1951) is an American politician, political commentator, actor, media personality, and retired professional wrestler. After achieving fame in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF, now WWE), he served as the 38th governor of Minnesota from 1999 to 2003.

title: Jesse Ventura - Ballotpedia
snippet: Jesse Ventura was the Governor of Minnesota. Ventura assumed office on January 8, 1999.

title: Jesse Ventura | The Institute of Politics at Harvard University
snippet: JESSE VENTURA was elected the 38th Governor of Minnesota on November 3, 1998 defeating Attorney General Hubert H. (Skip) Humphrey III and St. Paul Mayor Norm Coleman. He served as Governor for one term. Shocking the political establishment, Ventura became the only Reform Party candidate to ...

title: Jesse Ventura | Research Starters | EBSCO Research
snippet: During the 1990s, Ventura became increasingly involved in state politics. He joined the Minnesota Independence Party (later affiliated with H. Ross Perot as the Minnesota Reform Party) and supported MIP candidate Dean Barkley for the US Senate.

title: Governorship of Jesse Ventura | MNopedia
snippet: In November 1998 Jesse Ventura, a former professional wrestler and sometime movie actor, was elected governor of Minnesota after defeating the much better-known and better-financed candidates of the two traditional major parties.
